availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, physician and state surgeon general. Chillicothe, Ohio native. Son of Lucy Webb and Joseph Scott. Attended Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky in 1850. Married Mary Buchannan on April 30, 1857. Father of Lucy Scott, Mary Scott, and Anna Scott. Physician in Fayette County, Kentucky in 1850. Physician in Louisville in 1860. Served as a lieutenant colonel with the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from March 1862 to March 1863. Surgeon General for the state of Kentucky from September 3, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 213A
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, 4th Ward Louisville, p. 73.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0057.
“Deaths,” The Journal of the American Medical Association Vol. 60 (May 3, 1913), p. 1376.
Find A Grave, "Dr Isaac Webb Scott (1826-1913)," Memorial #8889294, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8889294# (accessed on June 15, 2018).
